page.title: 17Saturday in Halesowen
page.content: On Saturday morning I wake at 9am. I wash and dress and go downstairs into the kichen. I let Rusty, my dog, out and then I feed my fish called Spike. I switch the TV on and watch the cartoons. My mom usually makes my breakfast - cornflakes and a cup of tea. I don't see my dad because he goes to work at 6.00am. He is a tool maker. Later, my brother Jason joins us. Usually I go into Halesowen with my mom.We buy our food at the supermarket and then return home on the bus. Back home we have our lunch - usually beef burgers and chips. I often go with my mom to Birmingham to buy things with my pocket money. Evening is spent out playing with my friends, returning home before dark. Mom, dad, Jason and I watch TV again before I get sent to bed at 11.30pm, a late night, but it is the weekend!
